_header: Lord shield me from hell death at thilke grisly stound
Subjects: prayers, to God; God, prayers to
_description: William Herebert’s version of ‘Libera me domine’ — 14 lines

BLAdd46919.First Lines: Louerd shyld me vrom helle deth at þylke gryslich stoundeWhen heuene and oerþe shulle quake and al þat ys on grounde…
BLAdd46919.Last Lines: …What ich uol of wrechenesse hou shal ich take oponWhen ich no god ne bringe to uore þe domes mon
BLAdd46919.Attributed Author: Herebert (written in left margin beside first line)
BLAdd46919.Attributed Title: Libera me domine de morte eterna in die illa teribile & cetera (above first line, last word abbreviated only “ter”)
BLAdd46919.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.226-7.
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 67.
Gneuss,  Helmut. 
             “William Herberts übersetzungen.” 
             Anglia
         78 (1960): 169-92: 180.
